line_2: "In stupid indolence my life is spent,

line_1: To leave him, thus disgraced, yet innocent,
line_2: Fixed on thy grateful heart! nor thou consent,

line_1: To leave him, thus disgraced, yet innocent,
line_2: Thine undeserved neglect forsaken to lament."

line_1: Who tho' they die betimes, die innocent.
line_2: And those can have no reason to repent,

line_1: A Fool quite angry is quite innocent;
line_2: Trust me, 'tis ten times worse when they repent.

line_1: Not to know more, than to be innocent:
line_2: For had our earliest Parents been content
Grieves not at ills he can't prevent;
